name: Alexander Borodin
notableWorks: In the Steppes of Central Asia
biography: Alexander Borodin was a Russian Romantic composer, doctor, and chemist. Borodin is best known for his symphonies, his two string quartets, and his opera 'Prince Igor', which includes the famous 'Polovtsian Dances'. As a member of 'The Mighty Handful', a group dedicated to producing a distinctly Russian kind of classical music, Borodin had a significant impact on Russian music.
